briefdescription.para: Default constructor - construct an empty particle container that has no concept of a level hierarchy. Must be properly initialized later.

memberdef.definition: amrex::ParticleContainer_impl< T_ParticleType, T_NArrayReal, T_NArrayInt, Allocator, T_CellAssignor >::ParticleContainer_impl
memberdef.name: ParticleContainer_impl

briefdescription.para: Construct a particle container using a ParGDB object. The container will track changes in the grid structure of the ParGDB automatically.

parameterdescription.para: A pointer to a ParGDBBase, which contains pointers to the Geometry, DistributionMapping, and BoxArray objects that define the AMR hierarchy. Usually, this is generated by an AmrCore or AmrLevel object.

memberdef.definition: amrex::ParticleContainer_impl< T_ParticleType, T_NArrayReal, T_NArrayInt, Allocator, T_CellAssignor >::ParticleContainer_impl
memberdef.name: ParticleContainer_impl

briefdescription.para: Construct a particle container using a given Geometry, DistributionMapping, and BoxArray. Single level version.

parameterdescription.para: Geometry object, which describes the problem domain
DistributionMapping, which describes how the boxes are distributed onto MPI tasks
BoxArray, which gives the set of grid boxes

memberdef.definition: amrex::ParticleContainer_impl< T_ParticleType, T_NArrayReal, T_NArrayInt, Allocator, T_CellAssignor >::ParticleContainer_impl
memberdef.argsstring: (const Vector< Geometry > &geom, const Vector< DistributionMapping > &dmap, const Vector< BoxArray > &ba, const Vector< int > &rr)
memberdef.name: ParticleContainer_impl

briefdescription.para: Construct a particle container using a given Geometry, DistributionMapping, BoxArray and Vector of refinement ratios. Multi-level version.

parameterdescription.para: A Vector of Geometry objects, one for each level
A Vector of DistributionMappings, one for each level
A Vector of BoxArrays, one for each level
A Vector of integer refinement ratios, of size num_levels - 1. rr[n] gives the refinement ratio between levels n and n+1

memberdef.argsstring: (const Vector< Geometry > &geom, const Vector< DistributionMapping > &dmap, const Vector< BoxArray > &ba, const Vector< IntVect > &rr)
memberdef.name: ParticleContainer_impl

briefdescription.para: Same as the above, but accepts different refinement ratios in each direction.

parameterdescription.para: A Vector of Geometry objects, one for each level
A Vector of DistributionMappings, one for each level
A Vector of BoxArrays, one for each level
A Vector of IntVect refinement ratios, of size num_levels - 1. rr[n] gives the refinement ratio between levels n and n+1

memberdef.definition: void ParticleContainer_impl::InitRandom
memberdef.argsstring: (Long icount, ULong iseed, const ParticleInitData &pdata, bool serialize=false, RealBox bx=RealBox())
memberdef.name: InitRandom

briefdescription.para: This initializes the particle container with icount randomly distributed particles. If serialize is true, then the particles will all be generated on the IO Process, and the particle positions will be broadcast to all other process. If serialize is false, then the particle positions will be randomly generated in parallel, which each process using the random seed iseed + MyProc. The particles can be constrained to lie within the RealBox bx, if so desired. The default is the full domain.

memberdef.definition: void ParticleContainer_impl::InitRandomPerBox
memberdef.name: InitRandomPerBox

briefdescription.para: This initializes the container with icount randomly distributed particles per box, using the random seed iseed. All the particles have the same data and attributes, which are passed using the pdata struct.

detaileddescription.para: This routine is used when we want to replicate a box for a scaling study within each box the distribution is random but the particle data is replicated across all boxes in the container. The boxes are assumed to be those on the coarsest level.

memberdef.definition: void ParticleContainer_impl::InitOnePerCell
memberdef.argsstring: (Real x_off, Real y_off, Real z_off, const ParticleInitData &pdata)
memberdef.name: InitOnePerCell

briefdescription.para: This initializes the particle container with one particle per cell, where the other particle data and attributes are all contant. The coarsest level is used to generate the particle positions. The particle variable values are passed in through the pdata struct. The parameters x_off, y_off, and z_off represent offsets between 0 and 1 that show where inside the cells to place the particles. 0.5 means cell centered.

memberdef.definition: void ParticleContainer_impl::InitNRandomPerCell
memberdef.name: InitNRandomPerCell

briefdescription.para: This initializes the particle container with n_per_cell randomly distributed particles per cell, where the other particle data and and attributes are all constant. The cells on the coarsest level are used to generate the particle positions. The particle variable values are passed in through the pdata struct.

memberdef.definition: void ParticleContainer_impl::Increment
memberdef.name: Increment

detaileddescription.para: Adds the number of particles in each cell to the values currently located in the input MultiFab.

memberdef.definition: Long ParticleContainer_impl::IncrementWithTotal
memberdef.name: IncrementWithTotal

memberdef.definition: void ParticleContainer_impl::Redistribute
memberdef.argsstring: (int lev_min=0, int lev_max=-1, int nGrow=0, int local=0, bool remove_negative=true)
memberdef.name: Redistribute

briefdescription.para: Redistribute puts all the particles back in the right places (for some value of right)

detaileddescription.para: Assigns particles to the levels, grids, and tiles that contain their current positions. If periodic boundary conditions are used, those will be enforced here.
If Redistribute is called with default arguments, all particles will be placed on the finest level that covers their current positions.
The lev_min, lev_max, and nGrow flags are used to do proper checking for subcycling particles. The default values are fine for non-subcycling methods

The local flag controls whether this is local or global Redistribute. In a local Redistribute, particles can only have moved a certain distance since the last time Redistribute() was called. Thus, communication only needs to happen between neighboring ranks. In a global Redistribute, the particles can potentially go from any rank to any rank. This usually happens after initialization or when doing dynamic load balancing.

parameterdescription.para: The minimum level consider. Particles on levels less than this will not be touched, and particles on finer levels will not be assigned to levels less than this, either. Default: 0.

The maximum level consider. Particles on levels greater than this will not be touched, and particles on coarser levels will not be assigned to levels greater than this, either. If negative, will use the finest level in the hierarchy. Default: -1.

If particles are within nGrow cells of their current box, they will not moved. This is useful for subcycling methods, when fine level particles need to be redistributed but are not necessarily at the same time as those on the coarse level. Default: 0

If 0, this will be a non-local redistribute, meaning that particle can potentially go to any other box in the simulation. If > 0, this is the maximum number of cells a particle can have moved since the last Redistribute() call. Knowing this number allows an optimized MPI communication pattern to be used.

memberdef.definition: void amrex::ParticleContainer_impl< T_ParticleType, T_NArrayReal, T_NArrayInt, Allocator, T_CellAssignor >::ReorderParticles
memberdef.name: ReorderParticles

briefdescription.para: Reorder particles on the tile given by lev and mfi using a the permutations array.

detaileddescription.para: permutations is a pointer to an array on the GPU of size numParticles() with permutations[new index] = old index.

memberdef.definition: void ParticleContainer_impl::SortParticlesForDeposition
memberdef.name: SortParticlesForDeposition

briefdescription.para: Sort particles on each tile such that particles adjacent in memory are likely to map to adjacent cells. This ordering can be beneficial for performance on GPU when deposition quantities onto a grid.

detaileddescription.para: idx_type = {0, 0, 0}: Sort particles to a cell centered grid idx_type = {1, 1, 1}: Sort particles to a node centered grid idx_type = {2, 2, 2}: Compromise between a cell and node centered grid. This last option uses more memory than the fist two. Mixed versions are also possible.

memberdef.definition: void ParticleContainer_impl::SortParticlesByCell
memberdef.name: SortParticlesByCell

briefdescription.para: Sort the particles on each tile by cell, using Fortran ordering.

memberdef.definition: void ParticleContainer_impl::SortParticlesByBin
memberdef.name: SortParticlesByBin

briefdescription.para: Sort the particles on each tile by groups of cells, given an IntVect bin_size.

detaileddescription.para: If bin_size is the zero vector, this operation is a no-op.

memberdef.definition: bool ParticleContainer_impl::OK
memberdef.argsstring: (int lev_min=0, int lev_max=-1, int nGrow=0) const
memberdef.name: OK

briefdescription.para: OK checks that all particles are in the right places (for some value of right)

detaileddescription.para: These flags are used to do proper checking for subcycling particles the default values are fine for non-subcycling methods

for each real component, whether or not we include that component in the file
for each integer component, whether or not we include that component in the file
for each real component, a name to label the data with
for each integer component, a name to label the data with
callable that returns whether a given particle should be written or not
whether the data is written to a checkpoint or plotfile

memberdef.definition: Vector<ParticleLevel>& amrex::ParticleContainer_impl< T_ParticleType, T_NArrayReal, T_NArrayInt, Allocator, T_CellAssignor >::GetParticles

memberdef.definition: const ParticleLevel& amrex::ParticleContainer_impl< T_ParticleType, T_NArrayReal, T_NArrayInt, Allocator, T_CellAssignor >::GetParticles
memberdef.name: GetParticles

briefdescription.para: Return the ParticleLevel for level "lev". Const version.

para.verbatim:
The ParticleLevel must already exist, meaning that the "resizeData()" method of this ParticleContainer has been called.
Note that, when using a ParticleContainer that has been constructed with an AmrCore*, "resizeData()" must be called *after* the grids have been created, meaning after the call to AmrCore::InitFromScratch or AmrCore::InitFromCheckpoint has been made.
\param lev the level at which to get the particles

memberdef.definition: ParticleLevel& amrex::ParticleContainer_impl< T_ParticleType, T_NArrayReal, T_NArrayInt, Allocator, T_CellAssignor >::GetParticles
memberdef.name: GetParticles

briefdescription.para: Return the ParticleLevel for level "lev". Non-const version.

para.verbatim:
The ParticleLevel must already exist, meaning that the "resizeData()" method of this ParticleContainer has been called.
Note that, when using a ParticleContainer that has been constructed with an AmrCore*, "resizeData()" must be called *after* the grids have been created, meaning after the call to AmrCore::InitFromScratch or AmrCore::InitFromCheckpoint has been made.
\param lev the level at which to get the particles

memberdef.definition: const ParticleTileType& amrex::ParticleContainer_impl< T_ParticleType, T_NArrayReal, T_NArrayInt, Allocator, T_CellAssignor >::ParticlesAt
memberdef.argsstring: (int lev, int grid, int tile) const
memberdef.name: ParticlesAt

briefdescription.para: Return the ParticleTile for level "lev", grid "grid" and tile "tile." Const version.

detaileddescription.para: Here, grid and tile are integers that give the index and LocalTileIndex of the tile you want.
This is a runtime error if a ParticleTile at "grid" and "tile" has not been created yet.
The ParticleLevel must already exist, meaning that the "resizeData()" method of this ParticleContainer has been called.

Note that, when using a ParticleContainer that has been constructed with an AmrCore*, "resizeData()" must be called after the grids have been created, meaning after the call to AmrCore::InitFromScratch or AmrCore::InitFromCheckpoint has been made.

parameterdescription.para: the level at which to get the particles
the index of the grid at which to get the particles
the LocalTileIndex of the tile at which to get the particles

memberdef.definition: ParticleTileType& amrex::ParticleContainer_impl< T_ParticleType, T_NArrayReal, T_NArrayInt, Allocator, T_CellAssignor >::ParticlesAt
memberdef.name: ParticlesAt

briefdescription.para: Return the ParticleTile for level "lev", grid "grid" and tile "tile." Non-const version.

detaileddescription.para: Here, grid and tile are integers that give the index and LocalTileIndex of the tile you want.
This is a runtime error if a ParticleTile at "grid" and "tile" has not been created yet.
The ParticleLevel must already exist, meaning that the "resizeData()" method of this ParticleContainer has been called.

Note that, when using a ParticleContainer that has been constructed with an AmrCore*, "resizeData()" must be called after the grids have been created, meaning after the call to AmrCore::InitFromScratch or AmrCore::InitFromCheckpoint has been made.

parameterdescription.para: the level at which to get the particles
the index of the grid at which to get the particles
the LocalTileIndex of the tile at which to get the particles

memberdef.definition: const ParticleTileType& amrex::ParticleContainer_impl< T_ParticleType, T_NArrayReal, T_NArrayInt, Allocator, T_CellAssignor >::ParticlesAt
memberdef.name: ParticlesAt

briefdescription.para: Return the ParticleTile for level "lev" and Iterator "iter". Const version.

detaileddescription.para: Here, iter is either an MFIter or ParIter object pointing to the tile you want.
This is a runtime error if a ParticleTile at "iter" has not been created yet.
The ParticleLevel must already exist, meaning that the "resizeData()" method of this ParticleContainer has been called.

Note that, when using a ParticleContainer that has been constructed with an AmrCore*, "resizeData()" must be called after the grids have been created, meaning after the call to AmrCore::InitFromScratch or AmrCore::InitFromCheckpoint has been made.

parameterdescription.para: the level at which to get the particles
MFIter or ParIter pointing to the tile to return

memberdef.definition: ParticleTileType& amrex::ParticleContainer_impl< T_ParticleType, T_NArrayReal, T_NArrayInt, Allocator, T_CellAssignor >::ParticlesAt
memberdef.name: ParticlesAt

briefdescription.para: Return the ParticleTile for level "lev" and Iterator "iter". Non-const version.

detaileddescription.para: Here, iter is either an MFIter or ParIter object pointing to the tile you want.
This is a runtime error if a ParticleTile at "iter" has not been created yet.
The ParticleLevel must already exist, meaning that the "resizeData()" method of this ParticleContainer has been called.

Note that, when using a ParticleContainer that has been constructed with an AmrCore*, "resizeData()" must be called after the grids have been created, meaning after the call to AmrCore::InitFromScratch or AmrCore::InitFromCheckpoint has been made.

parameterdescription.para: the level at which to get the particles
MFIter or ParIter pointing to the tile to return

memberdef.definition: ParticleTileType& amrex::ParticleContainer_impl< T_ParticleType, T_NArrayReal, T_NArrayInt, Allocator, T_CellAssignor >::DefineAndReturnParticleTile
memberdef.name: DefineAndReturnParticleTile

briefdescription.para: Define and return the ParticleTile for level "lev", grid "grid" and tile "tile.".

para.verbatim:
Here, grid and tile are integers that give the index and LocalTileIndex of the tile you want.
If a ParticleTile at "grid" and "tile" has not been created yet, this function call will add it. This call will also allocate space for any runtime-added particle components.
The ParticleLevel must already exist, meaning that the "resizeData()" method of this ParticleContainer has been called.
Note that, when using a ParticleContainer that has been constructed with an AmrCore*, "resizeData()" must be called *after* the grids have been created, meaning after the call to AmrCore::InitFromScratch or AmrCore::InitFromCheckpoint has been made.
\param lev the level at which to get the particles \param grid the index of the grid at which to get the particles \param tile the LocalTileIndex of the tile at which to get the particles

memberdef.definition: ParticleTileType& amrex::ParticleContainer_impl< T_ParticleType, T_NArrayReal, T_NArrayInt, Allocator, T_CellAssignor >::DefineAndReturnParticleTile
memberdef.name: DefineAndReturnParticleTile

briefdescription.para: Define and return the ParticleTile for level "lev", and Iterator "iter".

para.verbatim:
Here, iter is either an MFIter or ParIter object pointing to the tile you want.
If a ParticleTile at "grid" and "tile" has not been created yet, this function call will add it. This call will also allocate space for any runtime-added particle components.
The ParticleLevel must already exist, meaning that the "resizeData()" method of this ParticleContainer has been called.
Note that, when using a ParticleContainer that has been constructed with an AmrCore*, "resizeData()" must be called *after* the grids have been created, meaning after the call to AmrCore::InitFromScratch or AmrCore::InitFromCheckpoint has been made.
\param lev the level at which to get the particles \param iter MFIter or ParIter pointing to the tile to return

detaileddescription.para: Create an empty particle container

This creates a new AMReX particle container type with same compile-time and run-time attributes. But, it can change its allocator. This is helpful when creating temporary particle buffers for filter operations and device-to-host copies.

parameterdescription.para: AMReX allocator, e.g., amrex::PinnedArenaAllocator

memberdef.name: Where

briefdescription.para: Checks a particle's location on levels lev_min and higher. Returns false if the particle does not exist on that level. Only if lev_min == lev_max, nGrow can be > 0 (i.e., including nGrow ghost cells).

briefdescription.para: A distributed container for Particles sorted onto the levels, grids, and tiles of a block-structured AMR hierarchy.

detaileddescription.para: The data layout on a single tile is determined by the value of the following template parameters:

parameterdescription.para: The number of extra Real components in the particle struct
The number of extra integer components in the particle struct
The number of extra Real components stored in struct-of-array form
The number of extra integer components stored in struct-of-array form
